```{.r .cell-code}
library(RSQLite)

```

```{.r .cell-code}
library(httr)
library(glue)
library(jsonlite)
library(keyring)
library("rstudioapi")
library(rvest)
```
:::

#Sending the GET request to the API

::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_f81dd32897064097f11c987ed6f7dbbc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
response <- GET("https://www.themealdb.com/api/json/v1/1/filter.php?c=Seafood")
```
:::

#Checking the status code and print first ten rows of your tibbles

::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_547b9767563fceca1e6e569a4eba8760'}

```{.r .cell-code}
if (response$status_code == 200) {
  # The request was successful
  # Get the response data
  rawToChar(response$content)
  
  meals_db <- response %>%
    .$content %>%
    rawToChar() %>%
    fromJSON()
  #-- Print the first 10 rows of your tibbles
  head(meals_db)
} else {
  # The request failed
  print(response$status_code)
}
```

:::

#Scrape one of the competitor websites of canyon and create a small database.

::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_04f1079b32808add7353a8448819d1ec'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Set the URL of the website to scrape
url <- "https://www.rosebikes.de/"

# Scrape the website
html <- read_html(url)

# Find the elements that contain the model names
model_names <- html %>%
  html_nodes(".products-slider-tile__product-name") %>%
  html_text()

# Find the elements that contain the prices
prices <- html %>%
  html_nodes(".product-tile-price__current-value") %>%
  html_text()

# Extract the number using regular expressions
price <- gsub("[^0-9.,]", "", prices)  # Remove all non-digit, non-decimal, and non-comma characters

# Create a data frame of the model names and prices
database <- data.frame(
  Model = model_names,
  Price = price
)

# Print the data frame
print(database)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
